title: Bug 18934: Scrollbars should be disabled in ImageAnalyzer example
OB: Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only). When the ImageAnalyzer example is opened, the scrollbars are enabled and can be moved around, but they do not have any effect. Even when opening a small image, such as an icon, the scrollbars are just misleading because they do not do anything.
EB: The scrollbars in the ImageAnalyzer example should be disabled to prevent them from being misleading and to align with their functionality.
SR:
1. Build F2 (20020602) on Redhat 7.2 with GTK2KDE 2.210 (GTK2 only)
2. Open the ImageAnalyzer example
3. Observe the enabled scrollbars
4. Attempt to move the scrollbars and notice that they have no effect
5. Open a small image, such as an icon, and observe that the scrollbars are misleading and do not affect the displayed image.
